author: mratsim
content:
I have added PoC metering to Constantine, I suppose you already have something similar for your own implementations but it can help give you a breakdown of basic operations for whatever we choose as basic: https://github.com/mratsim/constantine/tree/master/metering

For BLS12 pairings:

author: pauld.9606
content: I am trying to compare to our EVM384 opcode counts here for pairings https://notes.ethereum.org/@poemm/evm384-update5#Opcode-Counts-of-Cryptographic-Operations .

author: pauld.9606
content: Do your `+=*`, `double*`, and `sum*` all correspond to `ADDMOD384`? (Note: you have two `double*`.)

author: pauld.9606
content: Likewise for `-=*`, `diff*`, `diffAlias*`, and `neg*` to `SUBMOD384`? (Note: you have two `neg*`.)

author: pauld.9606
content: Likewise for `*=*`, `prod*`, `square*`, and `square_repeated*` to `MULMODMONT384`? (Note: you have two `square*`.)

author: mratsim
content: Due to overloading between Fp, Fp2, Fp4 Fp12 the report has duplicate names, I will upgrade it so that the "FpN" is reported as well

author: mratsim
content: the biggest matches with the base operations, you can discard the others.
